main_definition: An array is a collection of items, often in an orderly manner, that can be used to store data or represent different concepts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computer science, an array is a data structure consisting of a collection of elements (values or variables), each identified by at least one array index or key.
meanings_and_examples.example: The array 'grades' holds the scores for 10 students in mathematics.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An organized display, typically horizontal and vertical lines or shapes that are aligned to form a pattern or structure.
meanings_and_examples.example: She arranged her stamps into an array on her collection album.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A large group of people or things of the same kind, often gathered together for a particular purpose.
meanings_and_examples.example: The troops were formed in an array to march towards the enemy's position.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To arrange or line up items or objects in orderly rows and columns.
meanings_and_examples.example: She helped her younger brother arrange his toy cars into a small car array.
